title: 108_hr4550
content: The Act is titled the "Safe, Efficient, Coordinated, Unified, Revitalized, Enhanced Visa Waiver Act" and requires visa waiver participants to electronically submit biographical information. The Secretary of Homeland Security must establish an electronic system for visa waiver program participants to submit biographical information before entering the United States. The system must provide an eligibility determination within 30 minutes for nonimmigrant visitors. The Secretary of Homeland Security is required to establish an electronic system for visa waiver program participants to check eligibility before entry. Carriers must electronically inquire about an alien passenger's eligibility within 90 seconds. The system deployment should be prompt, and a fee will be charged to cover operational costs. Consultation with relevant parties is necessary during system development. Homeland Security must consult with a private sector group of experts in travel, tourism, privacy, national security, or computer security for system review. SEC. 3 amends the requirement for biometric comparison and authentication of visas and passports at all U.S. ports of entry by specific deadlines. SEC. 4 establishes a deadline for implementing technology standards. SEC. 4 amends the deadline for technology standard implementation to 2005. SEC. 5 introduces a limited good faith waiver. Section 303(c) of the Enhanced Border Security and Visa Entry Reform Act is amended to allow the Secretary of Homeland Security to grant up to 2 extensions for countries working towards meeting passport requirements, with each extension lasting up to 6 months. Factors for determining progress must be certified by the Secretary of State. The Secretary of Homeland Security can grant extensions for countries to meet passport requirements under the Enhanced Border Security and Visa Entry Reform Act. Reports on countries' progress must be issued by specific deadlines. The Secretary of Homeland Security, in consultation with the Secretary of State, will issue a final report on countries' progress in meeting passport requirements. Section 303 of the Enhanced Border Security and Visa Entry Reform Act is amended to replace "Attorney General" with "Secretary of Homeland Security."
